p: On a seasonal scale, the precipitation has a lessening tendency in the southeast region while increases are apparent in the southwest region in the spring. In the summer, only the southeast region is increasing in precipitation. The precipitation rate in the autumn rises in the northwest region and the Tibetan Plateau and decreases in the southeast region. Precipitation in the winter increases in most regions of China and the greatest growth appears in the southeast region ( Figure 7). In the southeast region, results showed the precipitation levels are decreasing in the spring and autumn while increasing in the summer and winter, which may strengthen the centralization of annual precipitation. Increased exposure of rainfall and flooding in the summer or snow water in the winter may have negative impacts on production and living [ 21].
